summary: The 21st Century Mortgage Act of 2025 amends the Federal National Mortgage Association Charter Act and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Charter Act to allow government-sponsored enterprises to consider digital assets when assessing the risk of single-family mortgage loans.  It defines 'digital asset' and 'qualified custodial arrangement,' and outlines requirements for risk mitigation, including adjustments for market volatility and concentration of digital assets. The bill mandates submitting the proposed methodology to the board of directors and the Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency for approval and review.
